Discipline was severe. Corporal punishment was often inflicted. The centurion carried arod of vine (oirt's) with which he flogged offenders. Other ¹penalties were loss of pay, canceling some years of a sol· dier's term of service and thus'postponin g the date of his dis· charge, exposure on the pillory in the camp, and expulsion from the ranks. Whole bodies of troops were sometimes punished by giving them barley (hordeum) instead of wheat for their lood; by obliging thern to spend the night outside the camp; by sending thern on the most undesirable service abroad; aod, in extreme cases, by decimation ; that is, choos· ing by lot one man in every ten and scourging him to death.
